title: Recent Advances on Generalizable Diffusion-generated Image Detection
author: Qijie Xu (Zhejiang University), Defang Chen (University at Buffalo), Jiawei Chen (Zhejiang University), Siwei Lyu (University at Buffalo), Can Wang (Zhejiang University), ...
relevance_why: The paper addresses methods for detecting images generated by diffusion models, which could inform the development of audio generation models by applying similar detection principles to audio artifacts created by generative audio models.
background: Detecting whether an image is generated by a diffusion model or is a real photograph.
contribution: This paper introduces a systematic survey of methods for detecting diffusion-generated images, achieving insights into both data-driven and feature-driven detection approaches.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing detection methods often fail to generalize across different generative models, especially when applied to diffusion models.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work categorizes detection methods into fine-grained principles, aiding in understanding how various models can be optimized for better detection.

key_innovation: The introduction of a structured taxonomy that categorizes current detection methods, offering a comprehensive overview and highlighting open challenges in the field.
real_world_impact: This research has significant implications for digital media authenticity and security, particularly in contexts where misleading images can have serious consequences, such as misinformation or fraud.
limitations: No explicit limitations mentioned by the authors.
open_sourcing: Reviewed works in this survey can be found at https://github.com/zju-pi/Awesome-Diffusion-generated-Image-Detection
